Conventional wisdom is coming to Westeros (and Essos).
We size up who's up, who's down, and who's treading water.

summary: Game Of Thrones Star Maisie Williams Joins Other Young Celebs In Demanding Second Brexit Referendum
title: Game Of Thrones Star Maisie Williams Joins Other Young Celebs In Demanding Second Brexit Referendum
excerpt: They want to stop winter from coming.
description:
Maisie Williams is taking on a more truculent foe than Arya Stark did in Game of Thrones. The House Frey, Petyr Baelish, and ‘Mean Girl’ (AKA: The Waif in Braavos) were negligible threats compared to the dreaded House Brexit.

Maisie has joined a number of younger personalities in the arts and entertainment industry in calling for a second vote on the UK leaving the European Union.

title: City of Love
body:
Pairing : Jaqen H’ghar/Arya Stark

Disclaimer : I own nothing

Summary : modern AU, drabble, a spy, a girl and a city. First published on AO3.


Her phone buzzed on the nightstand.

Arya woke up from a sweet dream she didn’t want to let go of. It was still dark but that little shift in the air, that poignant air of loneliness told her that he’d been gone. They had so little time. She pulled the covers over her head, cocooning herself in warm, sweet scent of ginger and cloves.

She wondered if he’d ever lay awake at night missing her the way she missed him.

Her toes curled at the memory of what had taken place between them in this very bed. Jaqen was an experienced lover and sinfully handsome. She knew he had been trained in the secrets of lovemaking somewhere in the far east. Though his touch wasn’t that of a spy, it was full of affection. She had learned to read him. His eyes always changed their color when his emotions were strong, she thought, turning from cold steel to deep indigo blue. Their hearts were pounding all the same when he kept pushing into her, slowly, murderously slowly.

Arya felt her face burned.

Was it really her who moaned his name over and over again and begged for more ? She chewed her lip, thinking how his rhythmic thrusts took her completely beyond herself.

The phone started buzzing again, bringing her back to the present.

Arya groaned and reluctantly clambered out of bed. Ten unanswered calls from her sister. Did Sansa suspect something ? Arya bit her lip. Had Lommy told her ?

The thick, plush carpet cushioned her feet as she walked towards the window. She took a moment to admire a breathtaking view below her. The bright glow of the rising sun transformed the rosy dawn into a day.

Jaqen had warned her they would sleep in cheap motels, sometimes they might even hide in abandoned buildings, depending on whom they wanted him to be. And yet, he had chosen this fancy apartment for their first real night together. Arya felt butterflies dancing in her stomach. Paris was a city of love, wasn’t it ?

She turned around and caught her reflection in one of the gold framed mirrors. She looked unreal, like a ghost. Her face was pale, her eyes gleamed feverishly, brown hair fell in tangled strands over her shoulders.

Her gaze swept around the room. Everything was perfectly still. Even their dinner remained untouched on the coffee table. The immaculate blue roses on the nightstand seemed to be carved in ice. Not even a petal fell. Had she only dreamed Jaqen H'ghar ?

Only the bed was a mess with its tangled sheets, tempting her to go back to that silken softness and dream, dream.

Arya skipped the shower and got dressed, closing her lover’s scent beneath her clothes.

An elderly gentleman eyed her up discreetly when she stepped out of the elevator, the guests in the lobby were giving her curious looks. Her wild hair and worn out ripped jeans seemed so out of place in this palace of luxury. The concierge glanced at her strangely but Arya ignored him too. She smiled to her thoughts, so happy she could dance.

If it was only a dream why do I still feel such love ?

blog.name: athimbleful
blog.title: A Thimbleful
blog.description: ...of salt and other stuff. (Not an asoiaf fan)

summary: I’ve been wondering if Jon’s reunion with Arya and Bran will happen in public. For some reason I’m thinking that they’ll...
question: I’ve been wondering if Jon’s reunion with Arya and Bran will happen in public. For some reason I’m thinking that they’ll reunite, especially Arya, somewhere privately and not in the courtyard when Dany and her retinue are received at WF. Thoughts?
answer:
It wouldn’t surprise me if Arya wants to observe the arrival of D/ny and her retinue from a distance. She’s in protective mode, and that will make it easier for her to read the new arrivals. And if Jon’s instinct is to pay a visit to the crypts, perhaps she could seek him out there. A private reunion would make sense for them. I think they both would appreciate that. It would make it easier for them to be honest with one another too.

It would also be great for the viewers. We’ve anticipated their reunion for years, and it would be really rewarding for us if that moment was just about them. No distractions, no onlookers, just Jon and Arya.

And Bran? Yeah, he might sit in his room or by the heart-tree and have Jon come to him. He’s not exactly a sociable person who cares about decorum at the moment, so I could see him not caring to line up with the rest of them to greet the Queen. And, like with Arya, it could be nice for the audience to get a quiet Jon/Bran scene instead of a long moment of Jon going from one person to another. That could easily become tedious and busy.

Thanks for the ask!

tags: especially when working with a show like got
a song of ice and fire
summary: you know, Maisie Williams is an amazing actress. Really she is, and she did amazing work as Arya. But boy, she does not know...
body: you know, Maisie Williams is an amazing actress. Really she is, and she did amazing work as Arya. But boy, she does not know Arya at all. She doesnt understand her character arch, she doesnt understand her motivations, she doesnt understand her personality. I dont how, though. i mean she is the one who bought the character to life; she is the one who bought the emotion to very essential scenes (ex. the needle scene), and her mom did read her the books. Yet the basic understanding of her characterisation is lost on her. I really wish she had read the books.  I am going to assume she read the scripts properly at least but it really doesnt seem like it with the recent comments she made on the conflict between Sansa and Arya, (which were very contradictory to the scripts). Truth be told, i always feel like she just repeats things she sees online. Half the things she says, i can literally trace them back to the parts of the fandom she got them from, and the rest is her own personal opinion, influenced heavily by her friendship with Sophie. Which i really dont like. She is an actor who works with the show, and is part of the crew and its her job to provide actual factual insight on to the characters, and be a valid source of information, but she and the general cast of got just share their own opinions or wishes on how they want the characters to be seen. Which is not fair, especially if they havent done their own proper research or provide very bias opinions. Its just very unprofessional in my opinion.

summary: I am just gonna say one (1) thing in favour of Arya not dying: the pack survives. Now, they've either said that to pull the rug...
question: I am just gonna say one (1) thing in favour of Arya not dying: the pack survives. Now, they've either said that to pull the rug from us and kill more Starks, or the remaining Starks will survive. I guess we'll see.
answer: i’m gonna say, since like, d&d’s whole shtick for story-telling is go setup, setup, setup, HAHA BET YOU DIDNT SEE THAT COMING BECAUSE IT CAME WITH NO REASON OR RHYME OR FORESHADOWING SHOCCCKK VALUIUUUEEE the rug is dust. also, god, i hate d&d so MUCH.

blog.name: julibf
blog.title: A Song of Ice and Fire

title: ARYA AS A QUEEN.....PART 1
body:
So, I have been talking a lot about the story foreshadowing Sansa being queen and I feel I am leaving Arya storyline behind, so I want to make good to my other girl. I mentioned before that I believe the fact Arya named her wolf Nymeria to be a big hint about her future as a queen.

Nymeria nipped eagerly at her hand as Arya untied her. She had yellow eyes. When they caught the sunlight, they gleamed like two golden coins. Arya had named her after the warrior queen of the Rhoyne, who had led her people across the narrow sea. That had been a great scandal too.

A Game of Thrones - Arya I



He was still trying to decide on a name. Robb was calling his Grey Wind, because he ran so fast. Sansa had named hers Lady, and Arya named hers after some old witch queen in the songs….

A Game of Thrones - Bran II

And in A FEAST FOR CROWS when Arya is forced on invent a story for “CAT” the new character she is pretending to be, she chooses Nymeria as the name of the ship who brought her to Braavos. I thought it was  interesting that a  “Queen” is taking her to Braavos where she is receiving her education in the Game of Faces”


“Just so. Your father was oarmaster on a galley. When your mother died, he took you off to sea with him. Then he died as well, and his captain had no use for you, so he put you off the ship in Braavos. And what was the name of the ship?”

“Nymeria,” she said at once.

A Feast for Crows - Arya II


________________________________________________________________


(art by Karla Ortiz)

NYMERIA THE QUEEN……….

According to A WIKI OF ICE AND FIRE, Nymerias was described as a witch queen, which is very interesting since Arya does have magic in her storyline as a Faceless Men assassin. If Arya end up as Queen in the North, she will probably be know in future songs as a Witch Queen too….

 

George is trying to connect Arya with the role of a queen a few times during the story. So, yes. I do believe this was the first of many of hints that George have left us about Arya ending.

________________________________________________________________


(art by Steamey on Deviant Art)

ARYA AND AEGON CONNECTION…..

Another point that always got my attention was the fact that Arya fit into a glove the description of the perfect King that Varys used to describe FAegon:

“He reads and writes, he speaks several tongues, he has studied history and law and poetry. A septa has instructed him in the mysteries of the Faith since he was old enough to understand them. He has lived with fisherfolk, worked with his hands, swum in rivers and mended nets and learned to wash his own clothes at need. He can fish and cook and bind up a wound, he knows what it is like to be hungry, to be hunted, to be afraid. Tommen has been taught that kingship is his right. Aegon knows kingship is his duty, that a king must put his people first, and live and rule for them.”

(EPILOGUE) ADWD


Now, lets pay attention in the way Varys described Prince Aegon and the points he mentions that makes for a good king in his idea…..


“He reads and writes, he speaks several tongues, he has studied history and law and poetry”…..

Arya was born in Winterfell and received a proper High born Lady education. She was educated in history and poetry, just like FAegon. And while she was in Braavos she was forced to learn different languages, she was told she needed to improve her Braavosi and High Valyrian, and the languages from Lys and Pentos.

“A septa has instructed him in the mysteries of the Faith since he was old enough to understand them.”…..

Because her father, Ned Stark, followed the Old Gods and her mother, Catelyn Stark, followed the New Gods, Arya was educated in both Westerosis religions. She knows the Faith of the Seven but its also fully educated about the Old Gods.

“He has lived with fisherfolk, worked with his hands, swum in rivers and mended nets and learned to wash his own clothes at need. He can fish and cook and bind up a wound…..

This has been Arya storyline pretty much after book 1. Arya escaped the city by joining the Nights Watch prisoners. She traveled Westeros by foot, having to hunt her own meals, cook her own meals, she looked for shelter among the common people in the scene where her and the Hound receive help from the old farmer and his daughter. She saw with her own eyes the destruction and misery the war of the 5 Kings brought to the people of Westeros and she understand how devastading war can be for the weak and poor.


 “he knows what it is like to be hungry, to be hunted, to be afraid…….

From up here, she could see a small wooded island off to the northeast. Thirty yards from shore, three black swans were gliding over the water, so serene … no one had told them that war had come, and they cared nothing for burning towns and butchered men. She stared at them with yearning. Part of her wanted to be a swan. The other part wanted to eat one. She had broken her fast on some acorn paste and a handful of bugs. Bugs weren’t so bad when you got used to them. Worms were worse, but still not as bad as the pain in your belly after days without food.

A Clash of Kings - Arya V

Fear cuts deeper than swords, Arya would tell herself, but that did not make the fear go away. It was as much a part of her days as stale bread and the blisters on her toes after a long day of walking the hard, rutted road.

She had thought she had known what it meant to be afraid, but she learned better in that storehouse beside the Gods Eye. Eight days she had lingered there before the Mountain gave the command to march, and every day she had seen someone die.

A Clash of Kings - Arya VI



“Tommen has been taught that kingship is his right. Aegon knows kingship is his duty, that a king must put his people first, and live and rule for them……

This has been the case of ALL Stark children, which is why we never hear them refer about the North as “mine”. They always call their kingdom “THE North” never “MINE North” or “OUR North”, this is a little detail that George puts in his writing that demonstrates the Stark  respect for the Land. They see the North as their duty, not their right.

So, by matching Aegon’s description perfectly with Arya storyline, I believe the author was giving us a hint about Arya final destiny.


I will continue later about how I believe this idea of two queens, one in the south and one in the North can happen. But for now I wanted to present that, in a unconvenciomal way, George may have been preparing Arya to be Queen in a very sneak way.

blog.name: devilsbastion
blog.title: I came from the sea
blog.description:
'Game of Thrones & a Parting Glass' lives here, don't ask why, but you can search by character or author if you wish. and sometimes i snap photos, write words, and paint pictures. and sometimes i realize it's all futile. <!-- Start of StatCounter Code for Tumblr -->
 
 
<!-- End of StatCounter Code for Tumblr -->

blog.name: gameofthronesdaily
blog.title: Game of Thrones Daily
blog.description:
Your tumblr source for HBO's "Game of Thrones" fantasy drama tv series & "A Song of Ice and Fire" epic fantasy novel series by George R. R. Martin. 
We post original content & check the public tag #gameofthronesdaily This is NOT a spoiler free blog.

blog.name: khaleesiofthegreatdairystate
blog.title: That's a very intriguing notion, in its own way.
blog.description:
I reblog nerd stuff, cats, and things that make me laugh. 
Egalitarian, liberal, anti social justice warrior, shipper of destiel, fan of Game of Thrones, Supernatural, Harry Potter, the Buffyverse, Star Trek, and more.

summary: Random hopes and head canons for Arya and Sansa
title: Random hopes and head canons for Arya and Sansa
body:
- Sansa dressing Arya. Making a Arya a Catelyn-like collar or an embroidered cloak with a wolf. Arya needs to dress more like a Stark, damnit! It would be doubly interesting if Sansa finds some of Lyanna’s things and gives them to Arya.

- Sansa teaching Arya about the politics of the North, showing Arya the boring parts of ruling it. I’m not sure if Arya still has this romanticized notion of what being a Lord is, someone who fights in wars and has adventures, but it mostly involves management of your castle and lands. This would allow some of Arya’s protective instincts to shine through, maybe even recalling what Robb quoted from Ned about how everyone in the North is theirs to protect. Sansa is proud and happy to Arya’s support.

- Arya teaching Sansa some basic fighting skills. Jon did say that all of the boys and girls would need to learn how to fight. Sansa would not remove herself from that obligation. Maybe she tricks Arya a little? Arya hits Sansa during their lesson and Sansa pretends to be hurt worse than she is. Arya starts to apologize and Sansa pushes her down. Sansa makes a point to Arya about Cersei and how tricky and manipulative she is. How they can’t fight Cersei the same way they will fight the Night King and Cersei might be just as dangerous as he is.

My highest hope for next season is for Arya and Sansa to be there for each other. Listening to each other. Understanding each other. I don’t think we’ll get any hackneyed fight like last season but I hope they don’t let their relationship completely fall by the way side for more “important” things.
